subject: Leadership
title: Listening to Dissent
description: Learn Listening to Dissent in one minute.

hook.text: An engineer at NASA warned about O-ring failure before Challenger launched. Leaders dismissed the concern. Seven died.

buildup.text: Dissent is data. When someone disagrees, they offer information the leader might lack. Silencing it is dangerous.

discovery.text: Psychological safety research shows that teams where dissent is welcomed make fewer errors and innovate faster.

twist.text: Leaders say they want honest feedback. But most punish it subtly: a cold response, exclusion, or being labeled disloyal.

climax.text: Invite dissent: 'What am I missing?' Then thank the dissenter publicly. That one act changes the entire culture.

punchline.text: The leader who kills the messenger eventually runs out of messages.

quiz.question: Why should leaders actively invite dissent?
options: Dissent provides data the leader might lack
It shows the leader is humble
